title: Physical Therapy
shortDescription: Improves gross motor skills, strength, balance, and physical coordination.
description: Physical therapy helps children with autism develop gross motor skills, improve balance and coordination, build strength, and increase physical mobility. Many children on the autism spectrum experience motor planning difficulties, low muscle tone, or delayed motor milestones. Physical therapists create individualized exercise programs and use play-based activities to help children achieve physical goals and participate more fully in daily activities and sports.
benefits: Improves gross motor skills and coordination
Builds core strength and muscle tone
Supports participation in sports and recreation
whoCanBenefit: Children needing support for physical activities
